item.title: Scheduled Queries vs Real Time Rules - A Guide For Detection Engineers
item.description: Most modern SIEMs offer 2 primary methods for running their queries: real time rules and scheduled queries. Each option offers a variety of pros and cons that you should consider as you develop your detection. Before we dive into that, let’s clarify what we mean by each. Definitions A real time rule, often called a streaming rule, runs on a stream of data. Essentially, as the data enters the SIEM, each line of data will get processed against the rules that correspond with that kind of data.
